title: Gyles Brandreth: I could never have been Prime Minister
text:
We asked the 71-year-old writer, actor, broadcaster and former MP what his younger self would make of his life

My three sisters were about 10 years older than me, so when I appeared I was like a firstborn. I came out into the world as a golden child; the golden boy, born with blond hair, although I don't have any hair at all now.

As the psychologists tell us, the firstborn usually likes the world. Because they are treated like a wonderful thing, they think, "This is all rather nice," and that is how I felt, for I had three much older siblings, who I imagine were amused by me, and I had parents who I think were pleased to have a son.

I was born in Germany, because my parents were part of the Allied...
description: We asked the 71-year-old writer, actor, broadcaster and former MP what his younger self would make of his life
